column5: Our MSc in Immunology & Immunotherapy will lead you through a wide ranging curriculum illustrating the relevance of immunology to the maintenance of health and the development of the latest immunotherapies for diseases such as cancer. It includes courses on basic and advanced immunology and immunotherapy, genes and immunity, biologic therapies, applied statistics, bioinformatics and host-pathogen interactions in infection. You will be taught by world leading immunology and bioscience researchers and have an opportunity to contribute to cutting edge research during your project.
column9: 12 Months Full Time or 24 Months Part Time
